availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: George Sanders Kimberly (Bracken County mechanic and blacksmith)

body.p: Residence: Foster, Bracken County, Kentucky. A Brown County, Ohio-born mechanic and blacksmith. Son of Luman Kimberly and Mary Ann Calvert. Married Nancy McCoy. Father of Edwin Bruce Kimberly.

bibl.p: Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Ohio, Brown County, Union Township, Ripley post office, 21.

Find A Grave, Entry for Rev George Sanders Kimberly (1836-1926), Find A Grave Memorial # 50137021, Mission Burial Park South, San Antonio, Bexar County, Texas, https://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GSln=KIM&GSpartial=1&GSbyrel=all&GSst=46&GScntry=4&GSsr=881&GRid=50137021& (accessed 20 Jul 2017).
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bracken County, Foster, p. 14.
